frame.name: Sounds
frame.definition:
<def-root>This frame is concerned with the percepts that vibrations which travel through the air or another medium produce in hearing organs. Sounds are a subtype of sensation. In talking about sounds, speakers often provide information about how the sound was produced. A <fen>Noisy_event</fen> may be mentioned which gives rise to the sound. Alternatively, the sound may be attributed to a <fen>Sound_source</fen>, which is construed as a point source emitting the sound. A further possible specification of what gives rise to the sound is for speakers to talk about two physical entities coming into contact by motion, resulting in either friction or impact.
Although this frame is defined in terms of a phenomenon of objective reality, many instances of the LUs in this frame are metonymic references to purely psychological phenomena due to a strong metaphorical relationship between external and internal reality. Furthermore, many of the LUs in this frame such as chuckle.n or whimper.n require a perceiver's analysis of a sound rather than being purely descriptive.
<ex>I awoke to the <t>clash</t> <fex name="Sound_source">of a jackhammer on concrete</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Noisy_event
FE.definition: <def-root>An event during which sound is produced.</def-root>

FE.name: Sound_source
FE.definition:
<def-root>An entity that is construed as a single point source emitting sound.
<ex>He woke up because of the <t>blare</t> <fex name="Sound_source">of a car horn</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Theme
FE.definition:
<def-root>One of two entities which is construed as moving relative to the other, resulting in either friction or impact. This entity is given greater syntactic prominence--it is either a possessor or an of-complement of the noun phrase head.
<ex>He heard the <t>clang</t> <fex name="Theme">of metal</fex> on metal , and a ricochet whined viciously past his head </ex></def-root>

FE.name: Ground
FE.definition:
<def-root>An entity construed as stationary on or against which the <fen>Theme</fen> moves, resulting in either friction or impact. This entity is given less grammatical prominence compared to the <fen>Theme</fen> and is usually encoded in a spatial prepositional phrase.
<ex>He heard the <t>clang</t> of metal <fex name="Ground">on metal</fex> , and a ricochet whined viciously past his head .</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Themes
FE.definition:
<def-root>Two entities that are both moving against each other, resulting in either friction or impact.
<ex>The sound of voices and the <t>clink</t> <fex name="Themes">of glasses</fex> was like music to her ears </ex></def-root>

FE.name: Location_of_sound_source
FE.definition:
<def-root>The place from which the sound emanates.
<ex>There followed a small silence that was interrupted by a distant <t>clatter</t>of metal <fex name="Location_of_sound_source">from the ward</fex>.</ex>
</def-root>

FE.name: Place
FE.definition:
<def-root>The location at which sound is produced. This FE differs from Location_of_sound_source in that it does not highlight the sound's spreading from its source to the perceiver's location, which is usually indicated by the preposition "from".
<ex>There was a <t>clatter</t> of running feet <fex name="Place">in the street outside</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Internal_cause
FE.definition:
<def-root>The noise-making may be prompted by either some outside phenomenon or occurrence, or by an <fen>Internal_cause</fen>, that is the mental or emotional state of an animate <fen>Sound_source</fen>.
<ex>She checked a <t>giggle</t> <fex name="Internal_cause">of hysteria</fex></ex></def-root>

FE.name: Manner
FE.definition:
<def-root>Certain properties of the sound relating to its production, loudness, etc may be of lexicographic interest if they describe properties of a sounds as such: loudly, shrilly, etc.
<ex>The Brigadier had heard the <fex name="Manner">faint</fex> <t>tinkle</t> of sheepbells</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Component_sound
FE.definition: <def-root>The sound percept may be characterized in terms of <fen>Component_sound</fen>s. <ex>The lunch itself was held in a huge room and there was a constant <t>babble</t> <fex name="Component_sound">of noise</fex></ex></def-root>

FE.name: Degree
FE.definition: <def-root>Expressions that indicate the loudness of the sound.</def-root>

FE.name: Explanation
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE idntifies the <fex name="Explanation">Explanation</fex> that the <fen>Sound_source</fen> produces the sound. Generally, this is some external stimulus that prompts the <fen>Sound_source</fen> to make noise.</def-root>

FE.name: Path
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Path</fen> along which the sound travels away from the <fen>Sound_source</fen>.
<ex>As he opened the throttle, the roar of the BMW's engine bit into the moan and <t>howl</t> of the wind <fex name="Path">across the culvert's mouth</fex></ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: babble.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the sound of babbling.

lexUnit.name: bark.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the sharp explosive cry of a dog, fox, or seal.

lexUnit.name: beep.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a short, high-pitched sound emitted by electronic equipment or a vehicle horn.

lexUnit.name: bellow.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a loud, deep shout or sound.

lexUnit.name: blare.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a loud, harsh sound.

lexUnit.name: blast.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a single loud note of a horn or whistle.

lexUnit.name: bleat.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a weak, wavering cry made by, or similar to that made by a sheep or goat

lexUnit.name: boom.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a loud, deep, resonant sound.

lexUnit.name: bray.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the loud, harsh cry of a donkey.

lexUnit.name: burble.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: continuous murmuring noise

lexUnit.name: buzz.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a low, continuous humming or murmuring sound, made by or similar to that made by an insect

lexUnit.name: cackle.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a cackling sound.

lexUnit.name: caw.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the harsh cry of a rook, crow, or similar bird.

lexUnit.name: chatter.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a series of short quick high-pitched sounds

lexUnit.name: cheep.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a shrill squeaky cry made by, or similar to that made by a young bird

lexUnit.name: chirp.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a chirping sound.

lexUnit.name: chuckle.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a quiet or suppressed laugh.

lexUnit.name: clack.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a clacking sound

lexUnit.name: clang.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a loud, resonant metallic sound.

lexUnit.name: clash.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an instance of clashing.

lexUnit.name: clatter.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a loud rattling sound as of hard objects falling or striking each other.

lexUnit.name: click.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a short, sharp sound as of two metallic or plastic objects coming smartly into contact

lexUnit.name: clink.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a sharp ringing sound, such as that made when metal or glass are struck.

lexUnit.name: coo.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a cooing sound.

lexUnit.name: cough.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a sound of coughing

lexUnit.name: creak.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a creaking sound.

lexUnit.name: crunch.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a crunching sound.

lexUnit.name: drone.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a low continuous humming sound.

lexUnit.name: gasp.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a convulsive catching of breath

lexUnit.name: giggle.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a laugh of such a kind.

lexUnit.name: growl.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a growling sound.

lexUnit.name: grunt.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a grunting sound.

lexUnit.name: guffaw.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a loud and boisterous laugh.

lexUnit.name: gurgle.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a gurgling sound.

lexUnit.name: hiss.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a hissing sound (when human, made in disapproval)

lexUnit.name: hoot.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a low musical sound made by an owl or a similar sound made by a horn, siren, etc.

lexUnit.name: hum.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a low, steady continuous sound.

lexUnit.name: mew.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a mewing noise.

lexUnit.name: moan.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a long, low sound, typically expressing grief

lexUnit.name: neigh.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a characteristic high whinnying sound made by a horse.

lexUnit.name: patter.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a repeated light tapping.

lexUnit.name: peal.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a loud sound or succession of sounds, especially of bells or laughter

lexUnit.name: peep.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a weak, high-pitched sound made by a young bird or mammal.

lexUnit.name: plash.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a splashing sound.

lexUnit.name: plop.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a short sound as of a small, solid object dropping into water without a splash.

lexUnit.name: plunk.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a plunking sound.

lexUnit.name: purr.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a purring sound.

lexUnit.name: quack.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the characteristic harsh sound made by a duck.

lexUnit.name: rap.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the sound of a quick, sharp knock or blow

lexUnit.name: rasp.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a harsh, grating noise.

lexUnit.name: roar.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a full, deep, prolonged sound as made by a lion, natural force, or engine

lexUnit.name: rustle.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a rustling sound.

lexUnit.name: scrape.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an act or sound of scraping.

lexUnit.name: screech.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a loud, harsh, piercing cry or sound.

lexUnit.name: scrunch.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a loud crunching noise

lexUnit.name: sizzle.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an instance or the sound of sizzling.

lexUnit.name: slap.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an act or sound of slapping.

lexUnit.name: smack.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a sharp blow or slap, typically one given with the palm of the hand.

lexUnit.name: snarl.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an act or sound of snarling.

lexUnit.name: snigger.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a smothered or half-suppressed laugh.

lexUnit.name: snore.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a snorting or grunting sound in a person's breathing while they are asleep.

lexUnit.name: snort.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: an explosive sound made by the sudden forcing of breath through the nose

lexUnit.name: sob.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an act or sound of sobbing.

lexUnit.name: sough.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a moaning, whistling, or rushing sound

lexUnit.name: squawk.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an act of squawking.

lexUnit.name: thump.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a heavy dull blow or noise

lexUnit.name: squeal.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a long, high-pitched cry or noise

lexUnit.name: thunder.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a loud rumbling or crashing noise heard after a lightning flash due to the expansion of rapidly heated air.

lexUnit.name: tinkle.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a tinkling sound.

lexUnit.name: titter.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a short, half-suppressed laugh

lexUnit.name: toll.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a single ring of a bell

lexUnit.name: trumpet.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the loud cry of an elephant

lexUnit.name: tweet.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the chirp of a small or young bird.

lexUnit.name: twitter.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a twittering sound.

lexUnit.name: wail.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a prolonged high-pitched sound

lexUnit.name: whimper.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a series of low, feeble sounds expressive of fear, pain, or discontent

lexUnit.name: whine.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a long, high-pitched unpleasant sound.

lexUnit.name: whinny.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a gentle, high-pitched neigh.

lexUnit.name: whistle.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a clear, high-pitched sound such as the one made by forcing breath through a small hole between partly closed lips, or between one's teeth

lexUnit.name: yammer.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: loud and sustained noise.

lexUnit.name: yap.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a sharp, shrill bark.

lexUnit.name: yelp.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a short sharp cry, especially of pain or alarm.

lexUnit.name: yodel.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a song or call delivered in such a way.

lexUnit.name: yowl.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a loud wailing cry of pain or distress

lexUnit.name: sound.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a thing that can be heard.

lexUnit.name: noise.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a sound, especially one that is loud, unpleasant, or disturbing.

lexUnit.name: bang.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a sudden loud, sharp noise.
